Topology Ashan Jayamal 2024-02-13 Chapter 1 Topological Spaces. Definition 1.1 A topology on a set \(X\) is a collection \(\mathcal{T}\) of subsets of \(X\) such that (T1) \(\phi\) and \(X\) are in \(\mathcal{T}\); (T2) Any union of subsets in \(\mathcal{T}\) is in \(\mathcal{T}\); (T3) The finite intersection of subsets in \(\mathcal{T}\) is in \(\mathcal{T}\).
